page.title: 11The Hotel at Craignish.
page.content: The Galley of Lorne (thought to have once been a cattle drovers' inn) is a 10 bedroom licensed hotel with restau- rant (seating 40). It is the local pub and offers a central meeting place and recreational centre for some groups and societies (football, clay-pigeon shooting, gun club competitions etc). Wedding and funeral receptions are held there & the Galley hosts both'Ard -fern Day'& the children's Xmas party. Video feature-films are shown weekly and folk & jazz groups, gymkhanas etc. are booked from time to time. Yachtsmen can use the showers and laundrette. Petrol is on sale (next nearest pumps 7 miles). Newsapers (if ordered)/ postcards from Galley shop. 12 people are employed at the hotel of whom 7 are residential. Visitors come from all over the world, & incl. ornithological/archaeological groups.
